page.title: 12THE CROSSKEYS PETROL STATION
page.content: In{1977,Shell}took over the station from City Petroleum. Since then, the arrangement of its buildings has changed 4 times. All of the electrical and computing systems now in use were first installed 8 years ago. In the near future, a diesel pump and more petrol pumps are to be installed. Each{tanker delivery}is worth between Â£3500 and Â£4500, their fill-up point is at the rear of the station to avoid inconvenience for motorists. Here, there are 5{underground tanks. No.1 - 22,000l., No.2 - 11,500l., No.3 - 11,630l., No.4 - 22,000l., and No.5 - 14,000l. The site of the Cross Keys is a {prime site}for trade and attracts many regular customers. The Forge Garage in Upper Hagley is under the same management, and provides service facilities.
